description: From a clipping of aggravation + -o (diminutive suffix), influenced by aggressive.

adjectives.description: aggro (comparative more aggro, superlative most aggro)

examples: “The Chuckster say you two be finding aggro idiot who kilt Long,” said Dude.
I thought I understood but looked at Charles for help.
“Aggro means pissed off.” translated Charles. He still hadn't cracked a smile. Tardiness made Charles aggro.

entries.meaning: (online gaming, MMORPG slang) Liable to attack without being attacked first (said of monsters).
(chiefly UK, Australia) Aggressive behaviour; loud, intimidating behaviour that convincingly threatens violence without necessarily actually becoming violent.
examples: Move along, lads; we don't want any aggro.

entries.meaning: (online gaming) A measure of how belligerent a player is – a high value may inspire either avoidance or preemptive hostile action from enemies.
examples: To reduce one player's aggro level, the other must build up his own.

entries.meaning: (online gaming, MMORPG slang) Hostile attention from an enemy that should target players with better defenses.
examples: You just pulled aggro off the tank and wiped the raid.

verbs.description: aggro (third-person singular simple present aggros or aggroes, present participle aggroing, simple past and past participle aggroed)

entries.meaning: (online gaming, MMORPG slang, intransitive) To become aggressive towards the player's character.
examples: They'll aggro on you if you get too close.

entries.meaning: (online gaming, MMORPG slang, transitive) To cause (a non-player character) to become aggressive towards the player's character.
examples: I aggroed the enderman by looking in its eyes, and it killed me.
